meanings.definition: Opossums: a marsupial mammal found in North and South America, known for its ability to play dead when threatened.
meanings.sent1: The opossums in the forest pretended to be dead when they saw a predator.
meanings.sent2: We saw a family of opossums crossing the road at night.
meanings.sent3: The opossums put on a dramatic show, pretending to faint when the squirrel approached.
meanings.sent4: The opossums' acting skills were so convincing, they could win an award for best performance.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the opossums playing dead left a lasting impression on the hikers.

meanings.definition: Opossums: the plural form of opossum, referring to more than one of these animals.
meanings.sent1: Many opossums live in the trees near our house.
meanings.sent2: The opossums in our backyard are quite noisy at night.
meanings.sent3: The opossums had a party in the garden, chattering and laughing all night long.
meanings.sent4: The opossums in the neighborhood seemed to multiply overnight, like magic.
meanings.sent5: The opossums' presence in the area was unmistakable, with their distinctive sounds echoing through the night.
